poem:
Title: "The Eye that Cannot See"

Not the eye measured,
but it rests still,
in unseen pastures.

No images dance,
yet visions rest -
observed by the seer 
with closed eyes.

The future, silent,
pupils dilate, yet divulge
no discernible dreams.

To the perception of pearsons,
puppets of the brain,
they respond.

O, the sterile mind,
nomad of existence,
unhitched from the chariot of imagery.
